Dear Mrs. Cnossen:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
2/20/2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(b) A true copy of verification of education from an
accredited college or university where minimum education
requirements are specified by rule.
One of eight files of employees hired since the last licensing inspection included a
photocopy the employee’s diploma and transcripts. Technical assistance was
provided regarding this rule following the 2018 renewal inspection.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
I recommended to the Chief Administrator that a detailed clothing and personal item
inventory be developed and implemented to make sure all items are accurately
accounted for upon admission and discharge. The staff who complete resident
intakes currently document what items are checked into the facility within the initial
intake assessment.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The chief administrator reported that there has been some staffing changed during
the year, but there was minimal disruption to the services provided. This was
1

apparent when reviewing the client files as they were complete and well maintained.
The staff and residents interviewed did not express any concerns with the program.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
